sentences.sContent: I’ll raise the subject when a suitable occasion offers itself.
sentences.sCn: 等有合适的机会，我会把这件事提出来的。

sentences.sContent: ...It also pluns to offer “voluntary separation” packages to 165 senior executives...
...These 18-hour cities are rapidly on the rise and offer great opportunities for ho investment in many of these cities such as denver...
...Many teenagers now offer to render service to the needy...

...But why don't we offer to pay for the printing of the programs ourselves on condition that on the front cover there's something like "This program is presented with the compliments of Norland Electronics"...
...but that we offer to pay for something specific like travel or something...
...is why claims that we face huge structural problems have been multiplying: they offer a reason to do nothing about the mass unemployment that is crippling out economy and our society...
...Burke was willing to offer some recommendations...
...e-learning can't offer human interaction in real life...
...Perhaps the reason why so many universities offer their students so little is they know studying at a top university remains a brilliant investment even if you don’t learn anything...

phrases.pCn: n. 建议书；报价书；录用通知书

trans.tranOther: if an opportunity to do something offers itself, it becomes available to you
